summary: This bill, known as Kate's Law, amends the Immigration and Nationality Act to increase penalties for individuals who illegally enter and reenter the United States after being removed. It focuses on stricter punishments for aliens convicted of crimes, including those who enter the country unlawfully and are convicted of crimes punishable by more than one year of imprisonment. The bill also specifies varying penalties based on the type and number of previous convictions and removals, including mandatory minimum sentences for certain offenses.
